intro: Swainsona luteola, commonly known as the yellow swainsona, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that are clustered in racemes, often blooming in spring. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Swainsona luteola is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
